userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright (or related rights to publicity and privacy) for materials in this collection, created by Joel Shufro was not transferred to New York University. Permission to use materials must be secured from the copyright holder.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The collection includes personnel records and student and faculty evaluations which are restricted (boxes 3 and 4). The remainder of the materials are open without restrictions.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Donated by Joel Shufro in 1984 and 1988. The accession number associated with this collection is 1988.017.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation

bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Joel Shufro was an instructor at the Center for Labor Studies (Labor College) for the Empire State College from 1972 through 1977. Shufro was active as a representative and as an officer in the Empire State College Chapter of the union, United University Professions, Inc. He also served on a subcommittee of the Academic Personnel Committee of the College.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection reflects the development of administrative procedures, curriculum, and personnel policies at Empire State College from its creation by the State University in 1971. The files include photocopies of memoranda, minutes, recommendations and reports from the various committees and administrative bodies of Empire State College. In addition there are course descriptions and samples of student learning contracts from the Labor College, as well as correspondennce, newsletters, newsclippings and petitions.
